src/config.js
content:
const config = {
  REGEX: {
    IDEVICE          : /iPad', 'iPhone', 'iPod/,
    ANDROID          : /android/i,
    LEADING_SLASH    : /(^\/?)/,
    COOKIE           : /(?:^|; )'+a+'=([^;]*)/,
    QUERY_PARAMS     : /[?&]+([^=&]+)=([^&]*)/gi,
    HTTP_PROTOCOL    : /^https?:\/\//,
    MAILTO_HREF      : /^mailto:/,
    TEL_HREF         : /^TEL:/,
    SPACES           : /\s+/g,
    NON_WORD         : /[^\w\-]+/g,
    MULTIPLE_HYPHENS : /\-\-+/g,
    LEADING_HYPHENS  : /^-+/,
    TRAILING_HYPHENS : /-+$/
  },

  DEFAULTS: {
    debug: false,
    delimiter: '|',
    redirectDelay : 100,
    prefix: 'Trackomatic',
    files: ['.pdf'],
    networks: ['facebook.com', 'twitter.com', 'instagram.com', 'linkedin.com', 'pinterest.com', 'tumblr.com', 'plus.google.com']
  },

  MAX_REDIRECT_DELAY: 1000,

  EXCLUDED_KEYS: {
    space    : 32,
    up       : 38,
    down     : 40,
    pageup   : 33,
    pagedown : 34
  },

  KEYS: {
    RIGHT_CLICK: 3
  }
}

config.MOBILE_PLATFORM = config.REGEX.IDEVICE.test(navigator.platform) ||
                         config.REGEX.ANDROID.test(navigator.userAgent)

export default config

Plugin

name: src/plugins/errorReportingPlugin.js
ErrorReportingPlugin
description:
Tracks JavasSript errors with message and line number

Should use exception tracking in next version:
https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/analyticsjs/exceptions

name: install
description: The setup function for this plugin

name: src/plugins/firstInputPlugin.js
FirstInputPlugin
description: Tracks what the first interaction mode is (mouse, touch, keyboard)

name: install
description: The setup function for this plugin

name: getMouseEvent
description: Returns the proper name of the mouse event for this environment

return.description: the name of the mouse event for this browser

name: onMouseInput
description: Callback for mouse input events

name: onTouchInput
description: Callback for touch input events

name: onKeyboardInput
description: Callback for keyboard input events

name: recordFirstInput
description: Tracks the first input used. Does nothing after the first call.

params.name: keyCode
params.description: The code describing which key was pressed

name: src/plugins/index.js
src/plugins/linkTrackingPlugin.js
LinkTrackingPlugin
description: Tracks link clicks

name: install
description: The setup function for this plugin

name: onLinkClick
description: Callback for link click events

name: getVisitData
description: Extracts tracking parameters from a clicked link

unknown.tagValue: { Object }      - the extracted category, action, and label for this link

return.description: the extracted category, action, and label for this link

name: extractAutoTrackingAttributes
description: Extracts a tracking category and action based on the url of a clicked link

unknown.tagValue: { Void | Object }     - Extracted parameters based on matching of url

params.name: url
params.description: The href of the clicked link

return.description: Extracted parameters based on matching of url

name: interceptVisit
description: Reports tracking data for the clicked link and then redirects to the link url.

name: createRedirect
description:
Creates a function that will redirect to the given url or if dev/debug mode
is on this function will return a noop. The redirect function is protected
by callOnce which prevents it from being called multiple times.

name: src/plugins/viewportTrackingPlugin.js
ViewportTrackingPlugin
description: Viewport tracking and reporting plugin

name: install
description: The setup function for this plugin

name: listen
description:
For browsers that aren't iDevices or Android phones,
listen to resize events and update dimensions in response.

For all browsers listen to orientationchange events
and update dimensions in response

name: trackViewportChanges
description:
Updates viewportSize and reports relative changes to GA
in response to window resize or orientation changes

name: calculateViewportChanges
description:
Updates viewportSize and reports relative changes to GA
in response to window resize or orientation changes

name: src/provide.js
providePlugin
description:
Provides a plugin name and constructor function to analytics.js.
Note: This function works even if the site has customized the GA global identifier.

params.name: pluginName
params.description: The name of the plugin to provide to GA

params.name: pluginConstructor
params.description: A constructor function for the provided plugin

src/trackomatic.js
Trackomatic
description: When called with `new`, creates a new instance of the Trackomatic analytics class

name: constructor
description: Trackomatic class constructor

params.name: tracker
params.description: Tracker passed in by Google Analytics

name: prepare
description:
Prepares the Trackomatic options by converting `options.networks`
and `options.files` from Strings or Array<String> into RegExp

name: boot
description: Loads all of Trackomatic's plugins

name: track
description:
Sends track parameters to the configured Google Analytics account via
the tracker that was passed to the Trackomatic constructor

params.name: params
params.description: Object of keys and values to send to GA/GTM

name: prefix
description:
When given a trackomatic tracking object, this function will add the
configured prefix to the `category` property

return.description: The tracking object with prefixed properties

name: notifyGTM
description: Provided `window.dataLayer` exists, `notifyGTM` will push values to it

params.name: params
params.description: Object of keys and values to send to GTM

name: notifyGA
description:
Sends track parameters to the configured Google Analytics account via
the tracker that was passed to the Trackomatic constructor

params.name: params
params.description: Object of keys and values to send to GTM
